intro: Cruckshanksia verticillata, commonly known as the spiral-leaved cruckshanksia, is a rare and distinctive plant species characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves around its stem. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its finely divided, feather-like foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring, forming dense, umbrella-like clusters at the tips of the stems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
